alert.note: Alert for Glynn; Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 6:29AM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida, including the following counties, Baker, Duval, Nassau and Union and southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Brantley, Camden, Charlton, Glynn and Ware. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, St. Marys, Kingsland, Brunswick, Fernandina Beach, Hilliard, Folkston, Woodbine, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Kings Bay Base, Taylor, Yulee, Macclenny, Homeland, Glen St. Mary, Kings Ferry, Nassau Village-Ratliff, Ratliff and St. George. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
